text:
Someone asked me what the advantage of
```struct T
    a::A
    b::B
end```
is over
```const T = NamedTuple{(:a, :b),Tuple{A,B}}```
This seems like such a basic thing, but I wasn't able to come up with a good answer.

elements.text: Someone asked me what the advantage of
This seems like such a basic thing, but I wasn't able to come up with a good answer.

text: writing your own struct means that you get your own name. This is nice for quality of life

elements.text: writing your own struct means that you get your own name. This is nice for quality of life

text: Second one is kind of ugly, too.

text: <@U0179G7FG4F> It's not just qol, with the second approach you can't use dispatch for functions you don't own without committing type piracy
